content:
The Polynesian Village Resort has a character breakfast option that's very popular among Disney fans: 'Ohana's Best Friends Breakfast featuring Lilo & Stitch.

'Ohana's Best Friends Breakfast is a family-style breakfast served at 'Ohana, a restaurant located in the Great Ceremonial House at the Polynesian Village Resort. The breakfast features a variety of Hawaiian-inspired dishes, such as pineapple- Upside-Down French Toast, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, and fresh fruit.

The main attraction, of course, is the character meet-and-greets! Lilo, Stitch, Mickey Mouse, and Pluto make the rounds to visit with guests during breakfast. It's a great opportunity to take photos and get autographs.

Here are some details to keep in mind:

* Reservations: You can book 'Ohana's Best Friends Breakfast up to 180 days in advance, just like other Disney restaurants. It's a popular spot, so be sure to book early to ensure availability.
* Hours: Breakfast is typically served from 7:30 AM to 12:00 PM, but hours may vary depending on the day and season.
* Cost: The breakfast is a fixed-price meal, and the cost varies depending on the time of year and age of the guest. Expect to pay around $30-$40 per adult and $20-$30 per child (ages 3-9) plus tax and gratuity.
* Dress code: The dress code is casual, so you can dress comfortably for a fun breakfast with the characters.

If you're looking for a character breakfast experience similar to Chef Mickey's, 'Ohana's Best Friends Breakfast is a great alternative. The atmosphere is more relaxed, and the character interactions are just as fun!
